answers.author: Thomas Terry
answers.text:
The City of Elko New Market with a population of 3,900 employs 8 full-time employees (4 Admin, 2 PW, 2 PD), one regular part-time employee (Parks/Code Enforcement) and 3 seasonal employees (PW) along with 25 paid on-call firefighters. Of course, staffing for any City is dependent upon a number of factors, including but not limited types and level of services provided, financial resources and local politics. For example, I mentioned that ENM has only 2 full-time PW employees supplemented by 3 seasonal employees. Most communities of our size in our region that provide similar PW services have departments 3-4 times larger from a staffing standpoint. Are we understaffed? No - lean, but not understaffed. In our case, a significant amount of our infrastrcuture is relatively new, requiring less maintenance. This has allowed us to provide the desired level for service with less resources. However, as it ages, we are seeing and increasing demand for resources and expect PW staffing to increase. Similarly, our PD is 3-4 times smaller than surrounding local departments in similarly sized communities. However, our call load is relatively low and do not prvide the same level of service. In short, I do not belive that there is a "rule of thumb" for staffing levels in smaller communities. Staff ing is dictated by the wants, needs and resources of each community.

Genesee County NY has approx 750 FTE's for a population of 58,000 with annual all funds budget of $140million; our operations include a full service Nursing Home(240 beds) , Sheriff / Jail/E911  ops that are county wide and Dept of Social services/Welfare that in NYS must admin. about $53 million in Medicaid payments along with all other State and fed safety net services. We have tried to be strategic in work force reductions and have been pursuing consolidation/cooperation with our local City of Batavia and adjoining Counties for shared services in areas of Youth, Jail population  mgnt. and sale of Home health services to private non profit provider.we also facilitated City's transfer of CON for ambulance service from FT City fire /EMTs to private service saving city about $2million /yr. NYS budget deficits will likely accelerate more of these type initiatives along with State imposed property tax cap with slim chance of  companion effective mandate relief.
